org.jruyi.common

Interface ITimeoutNotifier<S>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - type of subject

    public interface ITimeoutNotifier<S>
    A ITimeoutNotifier is used to schedule a timeout notification of the interested subject. It has 3 states in all. They are Unscheduled, Scheduled and TimedOut.

    The state transitions are listed below. 

     [Unscheduled] --(schedule)-> [Scheduled]
 [Scheduled] --(cancel)-> [Unscheduled]
 [Scheduled] --(timeout)-> [TimedOut]

    When ITimeoutNotifier is created, the initial state is Unscheduled.

    When ITimeoutNotifier goes into state TimedOut, schedule/ cancel will not work anymore.

    Since:
    2.3

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SCHEDULED
      An int value representing Scheduled state.
      static int TIMEDOUT
      An int value representing Timedout state.
      static int UNSCHEDULED
      An int value representing Unscheduled state.

      Sets the listener that is interested in the notification.

      Schedules a notification to be sent out in timeout ticks.

    • Method Detail

      • subject

        S subject()
        Returns the subject this notifier concerns.
        Returns:
        the subject

      • state

        int state()
        Returns the current state of this notifier.
        Returns:
        the current state of this notifier

      • schedule

        boolean schedule(int timeout)
        Schedules a notification to be sent out in timeout ticks. The previous schedule will be dropped.
        Parameters:
        timeout - number of ticks in which the notifier will be sent
        Returns:
        false if this notifier timed out or is closed, otherwise true
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is not positive

      • cancel

        boolean cancel()
        Cancels the notifier.
        Returns:
        false if either timeout or closed, otherwise true

      • listener

        void listener(ITimeoutListener<S> listener)
        Sets the listener that is interested in the notification.
        Parameters:
        listener - the notification receiver

      • executor

        void executor(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Sets the executor that is used to deliver timeout notifications from this notifier.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor to set
